mainEntity.name: What is Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) and how does it work?

acceptedAnswer.text: PRP is a regenerative treatment that uses growth factors present in the patient's blood to stimulate collagen production, improve skin quality, and accelerate cellular regeneration.

mainEntity.name: How many PRP sessions are needed to see results?

acceptedAnswer.text: Generally, **3 sessions** are recommended with an interval of **4 weeks** between each one. Results begin to be visible from the first month and continue to improve over time.

mainEntity.name: How long do the effects of PRP last?

acceptedAnswer.text: Effects can last between **6 and 12 months**, depending on skin type and aftercare. A maintenance session is recommended every 6 months to prolong benefits.
The application may generate slight discomfort, but it is generally well tolerated. Topical anesthetics can be used to minimize any discomfort.
